text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Abdellatif Filali meets Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo.
- Parliament unanimously adopts electoral draft law on general elections.
- World Food Programme signs protocol to provide Morocco with $16 million over three years for school meals.
- Moroccan sheep flocks now total about 17 million compared with 10 million during drought years of 1981-82.
- Collision between bus and a taxi kills three and injures 10 in Casablanca.
- Interior Minister Driss Basri says new electoral law is the result of continuous talks with political parties.
- Moroccan businessmen to visit Qatar and Saudi Arabia starting May 1 to initiate contacts and seek business.
- Japan to finance water project in southern Morocco.
- State-owned Office National des Peches to devote 33.5 million dirhams ($3.6 million) to upgrade 400 fishing vessels.
- Morocco's exports of fruits and vegetables affected by low prices on European markets.
